data.text: Notice is hereby given that Public Utility District No. 1 of Kitsap County (KPUD) will receive sealed bid proposals for the Bill Point - Part 3 Chlorination Project on November 30, 2023 until 1:30 p.m., at the KPUD Administrative Offices, located at 1431 Finn Hill Road, Poulsbo, Washington 98370. Sealed bids will be publicly opened and read aloud shortly thereafter at the Finn Hill Road location. Bids are being asked for provision of all necessary labor, equipment, materials, and appurtenances required for construction of approximately 216’ of 12” DI pipe and 340’ of 2” HDPE pipe with other associated work to include a hot box, chlorine tank, 2” air vac, minor electrical work, and other work as detailed in the plans and specifications. Reference vicinity map for project location. The time for completion is 60 working days. Plans and specifications are on file at Kitsap PUD, 1431 Finn Hill Road, (P.O. Box 1989), Poulsbo, WA 98370, copies may be obtained at a non-refundable cost of $100 each between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., Monday through Thursday or by appointment. Point of contact is Bill Whiteley, P.E., at (360) 626-7747. Copies of the contract documents may also be downloaded at the following location: https://www.kpud.org/about-us/vendors-bids/. Each Bid Proposal shall conform to the requirements of Section 1-02.9 of the Contract Special Provisions. Bids shall be made out on the bid form furnished with the specifications. A 5% bid guarantee is required in the form of certified or cashier’s check, or surety bond in accordance with the contract specifications. Contractor must be licensed to conduct business in the State of Washington. The contract will be awarded to the qualified bidder submitting the lowest responsible bid. KPUD reserves the right to reject any or all bids and to waive all informalities in the bidding in accordance with the specifications. All work performed on this project will be subject to the higher of the prevailing state or federal wage rates. KPUD is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This project is partially funded through the Washington State Drinking Water State Revolving Fund (DWSRF) program with federal funds from the Environmental Protection Agency; general contractors and all subcontractors must meet DWSRF requirements and provisions. Small, Minority- and Women-owned firms are encouraged to submit bids.
